headline: 'I found it easy against Gary Neville – he wasn't quick or strong and no skill was needed'
body: Gabby Agbonlahor sounded off on his battles with Gary Neville, claiming that the former Manchester United defender "wasn't quick or strong" in the latter years of his career
Gabby Agbonlahor says he found it easy playing against Gary Neville - admitting that he'd have loved to have come up against the Manchester United legend every week.

The Aston Villa legend had many battles with the former Red Devils captain on and off the pitch and according to the ex-England star, he'd wish they were more regular thanks to the on-field success he had against the right-back.

After Neville admitted on a recent episode of the Stick to Football podcast that Agbonlahor had once skinned him in a game, the talkSPORT pundit revealed while speaking exclusively to Mirror Sport, via AceOdds, that he found it easy coming up against the eight-time Premier League winner, albeit acknowledging that he'd not played him during his prime.

"I've said it before a bit tongue-in-cheek because he was at the latter stages of his career," Agbonlahor said. "I didn't play against the prime Gary Neville, so I have to be fair in that. When I played against him, he was probably mid-thirties, I can imagine.

"Early thirties, mid-thirties, and he was that sort of defender that I would have loved to play against every week because he wasn't quick, he wasn't strong." Agbonlahor delved deeper into his success against Neville on the pitch, adding that he needed no skill to play against him due to his superior physical prowess.

"It was quite easy playing against him because I had him for strength. I could hold the ball up turn and just knock it past him. No skill was needed. The pace was obviously me being in my early twenties. Yeah, it was quite easy, but I could imagine any defender that's similar to Gary Neville's attributes in their mid-thirties, I would have skinned.

"Do you know what I mean? I have to be fair on that. His age was a factor but obviously, he had a fantastic career." The pair had been previously involved in a heated feud after Agbonlahor said Neville's ex-teammate Nemanja Vidic was the most overrated defender in Premier League history.

The jibe forced the Englishman to hit back at the Villa icon by saying: "A guy who's played against Man United 21 times and won once and f***ing shouts his mouth off in an interview," on an episode of the Stick to Football podcast earlier this year.

headline: Premier League 2024-25: What's changed ahead of new season with offside and VAR in focus
body: The Premier League kicks off in Friday with new manager and players in action whilst leading figures have made changes to improve VAR's offside involvement and the way fans are engaged
The Premier League will return this weekend and whilst some things don't change - plenty will.

We have our constants - the Manchester City juggernaut aiming for another title, the newly promoted outfits battling to stay afloat and benefit from the riches on offer and the top four circus continuing with eight teams now in the hunt for the Champions League.

The VAR madness is set to ensue with opinion still split on whether or not its even worth keeping the system, which seems to cause as much controversy as it solves. Changes are incoming - more on that later - which are supposed to streamline it somewhat.

Chelsea co-owner Todd Boehly continues to throw astronomical sums at the playing squad at Stamford Bridge. Almost without blinking they've spent more than £100m on new players this summer with the Blues desperate to become a trophy-winning force once again.

They are all things we expected to happen and we'll likely have more of the same. In the 2024/25 season though we'll have plenty to get used to as changes - on and off the pitch - continue to come in. We take a look, before Manchester United against Fulham gets the campaign underway this Friday, at what we can all expect.

As always, there's managers needing to make good first impressions - some more so than others. For the first time since late 2015 we have a top flight without Jurgen Klopp. Arne Slot is the man tasked with stepping in to the huge shoes at Anfield - and looks set to do so without making a signing.

The merry-go-round at the Blues means that Enzo Maresca will be a Premier League manager for the first time, quitting Leicester to take on one of the most troubled and short-lived jobs in English football.

Brighton waved goodbye to Roberto de Zerbi and went for another unknown name in Fabian Hürzeler. When they hired De Zerbi many asked 'who?' - but it was the Seagulls who got that one right - and they'll hope to have done so again. They now have a 31-year-old leading them after some impressive work in Germany. Julen Lopetegui is also back in England with West Ham whilst it'll be interesting to see how Kieran McKenna goes at Ipswich.

I mean could it get any worse? For many the goal - or non-goal - scored by Luis Diaz at Tottenham still lingers in the memory. However we now have semi-automated offsides coming in - the system that we saw in the Euros - which will rid of all those line drawings.

The new system is set to be launched during the first half of the season. Multiple cameras will track player movements and record data points on parts of the body that are relevant for an offside decision. It is expected to take an average of around 30 seconds off the length of time it currently takes and, to be honest, it did actually work pretty well at the Euros this summer.

Admittedly we haven't had the blockbuster signings we've seen in previous years. The market has been slower than usual despite several stars emerging following the Euros. Man City and Liverpool haven't done anything major whilst Arsenal have only landed Riccardo Calafiori.

The Red Devils signed Leny Yoro - only to see him get injured immediately - but remain hopeful of more additions. Aston Villa have landed the likes of Ian Maatsen as they prepare for a first Champions League campaign.

Deadline day is still some time away though and the likes of Newcastle could yet show their financial might. Tottenham splurged more than £60m to land Dominic Solanke whilst West Ham have added new faces in Max Kilman and Aaron Wan-Bissaka

This is a new one, but could yet prove to be a hit if it improves transparency. The Premier League Match Centre has been set up on Twitter and will offer updates and reasoning on decisions that have been made by the VAR Hub - allowing fans to be way more involved.

The Twitter page said: "This page will provide live updates from Stockley Park including information directly from the VAR Hub. We will issue near-live updates on operational matters from all matches – including clarification on refereeing and VAR."

They added that the intel communicated "will be based on the factual information from the VAR Hub" and added that, if need, "additional information on Laws of the Game and VAR process from PGMOL experts will be communicated."

The Premier League isn't for the feint hearted and this year there will no winter break with the season instead starting later to allow for a greater summer rest period. Last year, for example, five games were held each weekend over a two-week period, giving teams at least one weekend off over January. The season prior to that there was a natural pause for the first ever winter World Cup in Qatar.

All of Europe’s other big leagues will have a winter break, with England's top flight being the outlier. That is often a bone of contention for foreign managers, especially when they face the relentless festive scheduling. Get ready for the rants come early January.

Last season we saw that breaking rules around spending is actually not the smartest idea. Both Everton and Nottingham Forest were deducted points, which forced them closer to the drop. The competition’s profitability and sustainability regulations are now keeping every club on their toes.
This season is the final year of those regulations, with two new forms of spending caps being trialed ahead of their introduction from next season.

Initially a “Squad Cost Rules” system will be tried - which will limit spending on players to 85% of a club’s football revenue and net profit or loss on player sales. A second system called “Top to Bottom Anchoring” limits spending to a multiple of the lowest combined prize money and cash from TV rights forecast to be earned by a team.

headline: Man Utd's transfer business panned by club legend despite huge £140million outlay
body: United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe has overseen two major deals for United this summer with Joshua Zirkzee and Leny Yoro joining the Red Devils - and more could be on the way
Manchester United legend Teddy Sheringham has taken a swipe at Sir Jim Ratcliffe for lacking "ambition" in the transfer market despite the club's active summer.

The Red Devils have been splashing the cash this summer, securing Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna for £36.5million and Leny Yoro from Lille for a cool £58.9million. Rumours are also swirling that deals for Noussair Mazraoui and Matthijs de Ligt could be sealed imminently in a £51.5million double swoop.

Yet, Sheringham, a key figure in United's treble-winning 1999 squad, isn't convinced these signings will change United's fortunes in the league. The club icon also took aim at Ratcliffe's involvement with the club, suggesting his hands-on approach "doesn't mean anything".

The former striker didn't mince his words, expressing doubts over whether the new signings would mesh well with Erik ten Hag's vision for the team, reports the Manchester Evening News. In a candid interview, Sheringham also blasted the new United hierarchy, doubting their ability to influence the team's performance on the pitch.

Speaking to onlinepoker.ltd, he said: "From my point of view, having a new football structure and Jim Ratcliffe involved as a minority owner doesn't mean anything. It doesn't even touch the sides, and it won't have any significant impact on what happens on the grass.

"It's just a new man putting money into the football club. Bringing in a new CEO and football executives won't improve the players or the manager. I can't see the new owners showing their ambition by bringing in a player that is going to have a transformative effect on the football club."

The ex-forward also doubted the potential influence the arrival of top brass would have on the pitch, particularly when it comes to a major leap in performance. United made headlines over the weekend, finally clinching a deal with Bayern Munich for Mazraoui and De Ligt as Erik Ten Hag seeks defensive reinforcements.

Despite the duo's significant Ajax pedigree and relationship with Ten Hag, Sheringham seems unconvinced that these moves signal a dynamic shift by United in the transfer market. He pointedly critiqued the acquisition of relative newcomers like Zirkzee, 23, and Yoro, 18, suggesting that their lack of experience might not make the quick impact fans are hoping for.

"The business that United have concluded so far isn't going to shift the needle. Yoro and Zirkzee are both young guys who will need time to adapt to the demands of Premier League football. There are no guarantees that they will be good signings - you don't know what you will get from them," he said.

This summer's transfer window buzz at United also continues with rumours swirling about more potential signings as Ten Hag aims to bolster the squad. Nonetheless, Sheringham has called out for recruits capable of consistent top-tier performances, underlining that the Red Devils require dependability rather than "inconsistencies", adding: "They're going to be inconsistent. Manchester United do not need any more inconsistencies, they need proper players that are going to give you an eight, nine or ten out of ten performance every week."

headline: Man Utd star Antony brutally mocked by NFL team ahead of new Premier League season
body: The Indianapolis Colts won their first preseason game of the 2024 NFL season on Monday night, but that didn't stop them from taking a shot at Manchester United winger Antony

In a bizarre NFL-Premier League crossover, the Indianapolis Colts have taken to TikTok to mock Manchester United's struggling winger Antony. The American football team posted a slideshow on the social media platform, poking fun at the Brazilian player.

The first image in the series featured quarterback Anthony Richardson with a quote saying "Leicester City had the greatest underdog story...", referencing Leicester's unexpected Premier League title win in 2015/16. The next snap showed running back Jonathan Taylor with a caption that read "No, Morocco did...", alluding to their surprising run to the semi-finals of the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

The final slide was a photoshopped image of Antony's face on Lionel Messi holding the Ballon d'Or, with the text simply reading "..". The post's caption read "1 nomination, 1 trophy", accompanied by several fire emojis.

The Colts, who boast 1.1 million followers, usually stick to posting NFL training camp content on TikTok during the offseason, typically with a Gen Z twist. Their video mocking Antony racked up over 200,000 views within the first day.
"Antony to the Colts here we land," read the top comment, a nod to TikToker WinnerTshipa. "No way the Colts are posting Antony," another user wrote.

Since his transfer to former Premier League heavyweights Manchester United in the summer of 2022, for a fee of £86m Antony has failed to meet expectations. Despite high expectations of a successful partnership with his former manager Erik ten Hag, the Brazilian winger has only managed to net five league goals so far in his tenure as a Red Devils player.

The Colts aren't alone in using the slideshow model as a means to share unrelated content. The Brooklyn Nets, despite their low NBA standings last season, have amassed over 2.7 million followers on TikTok through such posts. A recent post from July showcased guard Cam Thomas discussing Joker origin stories before eventually poking fun at "Mr. Lagoon". This post alone has garnered over 20 million views.

The Colts narrowly missed out on victory in their preseason opener, losing 34-30 to the Denver Broncos on Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium in Indianapolis. Anthony Richardson only attempted four passes, successfully completing two for a total of 25 yards. Taylor carried the ball twice for four yards and will be aiming to bounce back from a 2023 NFL season marred by contract disputes.
Indianapolis will continue their preseason with a game against the Arizona Cardinals on Saturday, August 17. They kick off their 2024 NFL season by hosting the Houston Texans on September 8.

headline: Man Utd transfer news: Frenkie de Jong speaks out on bid as Jadon Sancho makes feelings clear
body: Manchester United are once again chasing Frenkie de Jong after bringing two of his former Ajax team-mates to the club in the form of Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui
Manchester United are one of the busiest clubs in the Premier League as the summer transfer window picks up pace.

United completed lots of important business on Tuesday with Aaron Wan-Bissaka’s £15million move to West Ham confirmed. His departure – which required United to fork out a sizable fee – has paved the way for the arrivals of Noussair Mazraoui and Matthijs de Ligt after the Bayern Munich defensive pair were announced on Tuesday evening in a £51.5m double deal.

Their arrivals will come just in time for the start of the season, which begins against Fulham on Friday night at Old Trafford. There is still much more work to be done, however, with a few more incomings and outgoings expected before the window closes on August 31.
Here  Mirror Football  takes a look over the latest headlines and gossip involving Erik ten Hag’s side.

United’s interest in Frenkie de Jong has been long standing and with two of his former Ajax team-mates arriving at Old Trafford, the rumours are back swirling. United have reportedly already seen a €50m (£42.9m) bid for De Jong rejected by Barcelona, but Nacional claim they remain keen.

Well, that interest is not reciprocated, with the Dutch midfielder excited about playing under his new manager this season. "Staying at Barca? Yes, I’m very happy in Barcelona with my family, for sure," De Jong said. "Hansi Flick wants me to be key. I talked to him. It was good."
Ten Hag is a huge fan of De Jong, who played under his management at Ajax, but it seems as though he won’t be able to get the entire band back together.

Wan-Bissaka’s exit was necessary for United, who needed to free up space in the squad for De Ligt and Mazraoui, but it’s clear that his presence will be missed among the squad. You only need to take one look at the comments underneath his parting message on Instagram to see how popular he is.

Jadon Sancho wrote: “My family! All the best brother!” Marcus Rashford added: “Good luck my bro”. Wan-Bissaka made 190 appearances over five years for the club and paid tribute to everyone who made his time there so memorable.

“To everyone associated with Manchester United, thank you. You’ve helped me fulfil so many dreams of mine & I leave the club with memories to last me a lifetime,” Wan-Bissaka wrote. “I’m so grateful for the love, help and support I’ve had from players & staff during the last 5 years and wish you all nothing but the best.”
United have unveiled their new adidas home kit with new front-of-shirt sponsors for the 2024/25 season - and you can get your hands on it right now.

Graeme Souness has cast doubt on De Ligt’s ability, suggesting he is too “lightweight” to succeed in the Premier League. De Ligt is arriving at United because Ten Hag wanted another Ajax reunion at Old Trafford, but former Liverpool captain Souness isn’t convinced.

“I’m doubtful about De Ligt, I’m sorry," he told talkSPORT. "When I look at him I see a lightweight centre-half. What you want from a centre-half first and foremost is to defend. It would appear that some coaches and managers think it’s all about playing out from the back."

De Ligt has become the second centre-back to arrive this summer, following the £58m capture of Leny Yoro from Lille. It comes after United allowed Raphael Varane to leave upon the expiry of his contract and sold Willy Kambwala to Villarreal for a fee which could reach £9.7m.

headline: Marcus Rashford's transfer to PSG has already been approved by player he'll replace
body: Marcus Rashford has been linked with a move away from Old Trafford this summer after faltering under Erik ten Hag last season, and PSG are reportedly interested in his signature
Marcus Rashford's potential move to PSG has already been approved by the player he'll replace in France - new Real Madrid signing Kylian Mbappe.
The United forward was once thought of as an untouchable asset, but a recent drop in production has seen him fall further and further out of form, despite Erik ten Hag's encouragement.
Rashford failed to secure a place in Gareth Southgate's Euro 2024 squad, and as a result, his name has been linked with a move away from Old Trafford, specifically to PSG.

Mbappe left Les Parisiens in a blockbuster move to Champions League holders Real Madrid, and Rashford could be recruited to replace him. The French world-beater has previously praised the Red Devil and believes he could do a good job of filling his boots.
The two crossed paths in the 2019 Champions League. A Romelu Lukaku double and a 94th-minute dagger penalty from the Englishman were enough to overcome a 2-0 first-leg deficit and eliminate PSG.
Mbappe sung Rashford's praises post-match: "When you take a penalty in that situation, how much practice you have put on the training ground doesn’t matter.

"It’s about confidence," added the Frenchman. "He’s a player who plays with so much confidence. He’s one of the most dangerous forward players in England. Paul Pogba has spoken about how special he is – and he doesn’t talk about players in such a way often."

Rashford added ten Premier League goals to his tally that season and registered some impressive numbers. He scored 17 league goals in 2020 and 21 in all competitions the year after. A disappointing five goals during the 21/22 season can be attributed to a shoulder injury and illnesses.
On the back of a solid showing at the 2022 World Cup, he was expected to kick on under new boss Erik Ten Hag, and did, registering 30 goals in all competitions.

However, Rashford disappointed last campaign. He started 26 league games but only notched seven goals. With Rasmus Hojlund brought to lead the line, Rashford featured out wide with only the lacklustre Antony to challenge him - if a competent deputy was at the club, the 26-year-old's game time could've been further reduced.
Missing out on Euro 2024 and falling lower in Ten Hag's estimations has subsequently led to Rashford’s name swirling around the rumour mill this summer.

Though it is improbable the player will depart his boyhood club, PSG have the financial power to make the deal happen. The Red Devils have reportedly put a £70m-plus price tag on Rashford, who was subject to interest from the French outfit in 2022.
PSG have lost their global star and need a blockbuster new winger to replace him. With the departed Mbappe blessing the deal, Rashford could be the man to replace him, unlikely as it may seem.

headline: Bruno Fernandes' problem with Anthony Martial explains Erik ten Hag's transfer decision
body: Anthony Martial has left Old Trafford this summer after nearly 10 years at Manchester United, and captain Bruno Fernandes inadvertently provided insight into the forward's departure
Anthony Martial's inability to lock down a position at Manchester United could be why Erik ten Hag ousted him from the squad.
The French forward made over 300 appearances and netted 90 goals during his nine-year United tenure after joining for what was a world record fee for a teenager in 2019.
Martial's contract was allowed to expire this summer, and he is currently a free agent. The 28-year-old never entirely made a forward position his own at Old Trafford.

Club captain Bruno Fernandes previously inadvertently cited this positional limbo as reasoning for Martial's departure, highlighting the forward's failure to score the necessary goals as a number nine and lack of assists when playing wide.
"With Marcus, there is always that kind of joke with him and Anto [Anthony Martial]," Fernandes told the club in 2020. "I say to them every time I pass to them, they never score.
"They never give me assists. You see again that Anto missed that chance against Leeds. Straight away, I looked at him and started smiling. He understands what I mean by that.

"I think it’s good, it’s positive. Of course, sometimes you have to shout at your team-mate and call him to do different things, that’s also a big part of the game, that you’re pushing a bit more for the other team-mates."

The French ace made 19 appearances in all competitions under Ten Hag last season, scoring just twice. His season was cut short by groin surgery in February, but before this, he was primarily used as a substitute.

There were times when it seemed Martial could have what it took to lead the Red Devils' line, though. During the 2019/20 season, he registered 17 league goals - including a hattrick against Sheffield United - and added a further six in other competitions.
This was under old boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, but upon Ten Hag's arrival, Martial started just two league matches before being shipped out on loan to La Liga outfit Sevilla in 2022.
The issue Fernandes revealed - that Martial lacks true goalscoring instinct and cannot play as a prolific winger - perhaps resonated with Ten Hag.

He may have felt that other players could more efficiently do the job Martial had been doing out wide, and brought in promising young marksman Rasmus Hojlund to score goals where the Frenchman disappointed.

This summer, a very similar player to Martial was signed - £36.5m recruit Joshua Zirkzee. Ten Hag clearly believes that he has found pieces who can play Martial's role better, hence the decision to let him walk away for free.

headline: Man Utd legend disagrees with Paul Scholes over 'second-rate' Matthijs de Ligt
body: Paul Scholes has dubbed Matthijs de Ligt a "second-rate" signing for Manchester United as the Bayern Munich defender arrives for a medical, however, a former Red Devils team-mate disagrees
Teddy Sheringham has dismissed Paul Scholes' rant over Manchester United's signing of Matthijs de Ligt.

The Red Devils are on the brink of acquiring the 25-year-old from Bayern Munich in a deal worth a reported £43million, with the centre-half arriving in Manchester on Monday evening for a medical at Carrington. De Ligt fell out of favour in Bavaria recently, with former Spurs outcast Eric Dier starting in his place.

The sturdy defender only joined Bayern from Juventus in 2022, but he's on the move once again - this time to England's north west. He comes as the third big summer signing for Erik ten Hag, with Leny Yoro joining from Lille for £58m and forward Joshua Zirkzee coming aboard from Bologna for £36.5m. De Ligt is also being joined by Munich team-mate Noussair Mazraoui at Old Trafford.

However, a number of former Manchester United players have been critical of Ten Hag's vision with De Ligt, and midfield icon Scholes slammed the Dutchman as "second-rate". He said: "You know what? Manchester United are talking about bringing players in who won’t get in their team."

On De Ligt, he added: "He’s not played for them. That’s a big concern for me, especially when Eric Dier’s playing in front of him. I’m not joking; that is a massive concern for me. You’re bringing in players for £40million, £50million, okay, just because he’s played for them three or four years ago.

"Juventus got rid of him; he wasn’t good enough at Juventus, he obviously hasn’t been good enough for Bayern Munich. He’s coming to us almost like a second-rate defender now." Meanwhile, Rio Ferdinand pondered: "He's had a lot of injuries, hasn't started many games over the last two or three years and Man United are spending £45-50million on him.

"Is he going to come into Man United and make a difference? I think it's a big ask for him and all eyes are going to be on him. Big pressure, big opportunity for him, but there's a lot of uncertainty I think with this signing because of his previous seasons with two big clubs not going as well as we'd have anticipated."

However, another legend, Sheringham, has disagreed with presumptions about De Ligt, instead praising his leadership. The former United striker told OnlinePokerLTD: "They need leaders. That’s why I like the rumours about Matthijs de Ligt, because even though he’s 24, he’s been there and done it winning titles in Holland, Italy and Germany. Leaders drag other people along with you.

"Manchester United don’t need any more young players making mistakes, or players that are learning their trade and doing okay. Doing okay for Man United is not good enough. You’ve got to be challenging. You’ve got to be up there. You’ve got to be demanding of what’s happening at your football club.

"I don’t see enough big players at the club who set the standard. I really like Martinez; I think he was missed last season. He’ll make a big difference for me. I think he’s a good leader for the team." Sheringham added: "I like the signing of Matthijs de Ligt. Erik ten Hag made him the youngest ever captain of Ajax and he has played for some big clubs in Juventus and Bayern since he left Amsterdam.

headline: Man Utd draw up new Ivan Toney transfer plan after Brentford response
body: Ivan Toney's future has been speculated on this summer with the likes of Manchester United, Arsenal and Chelsea linked with making a move for the Bees' striker as his contract runs down
Manchester United could yet be tempted by a loan deal for Brentford forward Ivan Toney.

The Bees have stood firm so far this summer, and require £60million to part ways with their star striker. The England international has less than a year on his contract and has shown no desire to extend his stay at the G-tech Stadium.

No club has yet proved willing to meet that figure, with the possibility that patience could not prove beneficial for any suitor. At 28, Toney is an older forward that clubs such as Manchester United and Chelsea would not ideally target, though they have been interested in the striker, along with Arsenal.

The Independent report that the Old Trafford side, like Chelsea, are willing to wait until nearer the end of the transfer window to potentially make a move. It is expected the Bees' position will be weakened at that stage and clubs could become creative.

That could see Toney move for a reduced fee or even on loan as Brentford attempt to realise some of the former Newcastle forward's valuation. A loan offer for Toney, with an obligation to buy could yet be forthcoming it is reported.

United are reluctant to spend a large figure on Toney's profile under their new recruitment team, with the club having been restricted by profit and sustainability rules too. While the club's priorities lie in midfield, after having signed the likes of Joshua Zirkzee and Matthijs de Ligt, a forward remains of interest.

Brentford boss Thomas Frank has admitted this summer that he would love Toney to stay despite the speculation. The Bees' head coach also confirmed that the former Peterborough star would not be let go cheaply due to his goalscoring status.
"You never know, he is a Brentford player. I would love him to stay. They'll give me a very positive challenge," Frank told Sky Sports last month.
"But, you know, I haven't met a coach that didn't want as many good players as possible. So right now, Ivan is a Brentford player.

headline: Micah Richards disagrees with Paul Scholes over damning Man Utd transfer assessment
body: Manchester United are on the verge of sealing a double deal for Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui, and there has been some disagreement over the Bayern Munich pair
Micah Richards doesn't share Paul Scholes' concerns about Matthijs de Ligt as the Dutch international closes in on his move to Manchester United.

De Ligt is set for a reunion with Erik ten Hag, the man who handed him the captain's armband at Ajax. It will see him continue a nomadic career since leaving Amsterdam, with his former Ajax colleague Noussair Mazraoui also poised to trade Bayern Munich for Old Trafford this summer.

The incoming duo will help replace Raphael Varane and Aaron Wan-Bissaka, both of whom have moved on. Varane joined Como following the expiry of his United contract, while Wan-Bissaka has completed a £15m switch to West Ham.

United have already signed Joshua Zirkzee and Leny Yoro, though the latter will miss the start of the season through injury. That could open the door for De Ligt to earn starts early in the campaign, but questions remain - even if Richards is convinced.

Speaking on The Rest is Football podcast, Richards suggested De Ligt could allow United to solve one of United's more consistent issues from last season. "When we talk about Man United and the way they play, the structure of the team, sometimes they sit really deep because they’ve not got the pace,"he said

"If you get De Ligt in the team… I wouldn’t say he’s rapid but he’s not as slow as someone like Maguire on the turn and that’s no disrespect to Maguire. So I think they can afford to be a bit more adventurous"

Summer signing Yoro appears to be an upgrade in the pace department, but is out of commission after picking up an injury in pre-season. United started with a centre-back pairing of Harry Maguire and Jonny Evans in the Community Shield, with Lisandro Martinez forced to start at left-back while Luke Shaw and Tyrell Malacia work their way back to match-fitness.

Unlike his fellow pundit, Scholes remains unconvinced by De Ligt after following his Bayern spell. “[De Ligt] from Bayern Munich… he’s not played for them," he said on The Overlap Fan Debate. While De Ligt started last season in and out of the team, he played more regularly when fit towards its conclusion.

"That’s a big concern for me, especially when Eric Dier’s playing in front of him," Scholes continued. "I’m not joking; that is a massive concern for me. You’re bringing in players for £40 million, £50 million, okay, just because he’s played for them three or four years ago…
"Juventus got rid of him; he wasn’t good enough at Juventus, he obviously hasn’t been good enough for Bayern Munich. He’s coming to us almost like a second-rate defender now."

United need to confirm the arrival of De Ligt and Mazraoui by Thursday lunchtime if the pair are to be available for the first weekend of the new Premier League season. Erik ten Hag's side will host Fulham in their opener, fresh off their penalty shoot-out defeat to Manchester City in the Community Shield.

headline: Barcelona could be forced to go against Frenkie de Jong wishes after Man Utd bid
body: Manchester United have previously chased Frenkie de Jong and Barcelona's current situation could leave the Red Devils in a strong position to return for the Dutchman
Barcelona's financial situation could leave them unable to register new signing Dani Olmo, and that could work in Manchester United's favour.
The Spain star completed a £60million move after tasting Euro 2024 success with the national side. As things stand however, the star may not be unable to start the new season with the Catalan club.

News outlet Cadena SER suggest that Barca are at risk of being unable to register Olmo and other players if they fail to solve the financial problems that have seen La Liga cut their salary allowance. The club have a €100million (£85m) hole in their 2023/24 accounts after failing to receive funds owed from the 'levers' they actioned to raise money in 2022.
Outside of finding new avenues to raise the money, the simplest way to get back on track and also reduce the wage bill simultaneously is to sell players. That could leave Frenkie de Jong vulnerable.

The Dutch midfielder's deal expires in 2026 with no negotiations underway over fresh terms. It has been been said that Barcelona may be willing to part ways with the player for £51m, short of the £65m they spent in 2019.

De Jong is keen to remain at Camp Nou however. "Staying at Barca? Yes, I’m very happy in Barcelona with my family, for sure," De Jong said. "Hansi Flick wants me to be key. I talked to him. It was good."
Manchester United could offer Barcelona a boost as landing a midfielder remains their priority. De Jong, who worked under Erik ten Hag at Ajax, has previously been a target for the Red Devils.

United's boss has even revealed how he planned to utilise the 27-year-old. "It would have been Frenkie de Jong and Casemiro [in the middle]," Ten Hag revealed to Gary Neville. "They would really be connected with each other. They would be really complementary to each other. That's a typical player. If you want to play the Ajax style, you need that type of player."

United announced the signing of two other ex-Ajax stars on Tuesday. Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui completed their respective transfers from Bayern Munich as the club reinforced its defence. The club have also signed Dutch forward Joshua Zirkzee, with the centre of midfield the key position they have yet to strengthen.

headline: Man Utd chief Dan Ashworth makes plan clear after double transfer swoop confirmed
body: Manchester United have completed the signings of Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui from Bayern Munich - and they address clear weaknesses before the opening Premier League game
Noussair Mazraoui can immediately address Manchester United's problem position after completing his transfer from Bayern Munich on the eve of the Premier League season.

United begin their campaign against Fulham at Old Trafford on Friday night and appeared to have a major issue following the news that Luke Shaw will miss the start of the season with a calf injury. Shaw has struggled with injuries in the past year and his understudy, Tyrell Malacia, is still not ready to return after missing all of last season through injury.

Thankfully for Erik ten Hag, United have managed to get the double deal over the line for Mazraoui and Matthijs de Ligt before the Fulham match. The club announced on Tuesday evening that they had completed the transfers for the two Bayern Munich defenders, who have joined for a combined £51.5million.

And while Mazraoui is right-footed, is better known as a right-back and has come primarily to replace Aaron Wan-Bissaka, who has joined West Ham for £15m, he is also capable of playing at left-back. United sporting director Dan Ashworth made a point of noting that in United's statement upon his arrival.

“Noussair is a dynamic, attacking full-back who can play on both the right and left side of defence," Ashworth said. "His experience and versatility will make him an excellent addition to our squad. Having already won a number of trophies in his career, we know that Noussair’s winning mentality will be a real asset to the group as we work together to deliver the success required of Manchester United.”

Mazraoui has signed a four-year deal with the option of a further 12 months. He said: “It’s an incredible feeling to be a Manchester United player, and I cannot wait to walk out at Old Trafford wearing the red shirt. I know that I’m joining the club at an exciting time; everyone I’ve spoken to has the same ambition for us to win trophies together and I can feel the determination to achieve that.

“Erik ten Hag played an important part in my development as a player, so it is exciting to be reuniting with him as I enter the prime years of my career. I know what he expects from his players, and I will give everything to help the group be successful.”

De Ligt could also go straight into the United team to face Fulham after signing a five-year contract with the option of a further year. Like Mazraoui, he worked under Ten Hag at Ajax before moving to Bayern Munich and could be thrust into the side after fellow new arrival Leny Yoro suffered a foot injury following his £58m move from Lille.

“As soon as I heard that Manchester United wanted me, I felt an excitement about the opportunity for a new challenge at such an historic club," De Ligt said. "In the conversations that followed, I was impressed by the vision that the football leadership set out, and the role they saw for me in it."

headline: opinionErik ten Hag's new Man Utd XI and why £150million spend doesn't hide big question mark
body: Erik ten Hag, aided by the decisions made by the club's new hierarchy, has spent nearly £150million on improving Manchester United this summer - but feels there is still one position left to fill
Much is expected of Erik ten Hag after he was almost sacked at the end of last season’s record-low Premier League campaign.

Manchester United's unexpected FA Cup Final win over Manchester City showed he could mastermind success over their rivals in big one-off games. Ten Hag’s challenge now is to translate this to the Premier League and show United can sustain a prolonged campaign and qualify at least for the top four.

He’s tried to strengthen United in attack, where he has landed Joshua Zirkzee, and at the back with the double capture of Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui meaning three defenders have come through the door following Leny Yoro's transfer.
He needs to score more and concede fewer goals and this is their template for success.
Andre Onana will continue as Ten Hag’s No.1 and his form was patchy last season. He will hope he can settle into his position and inject some much-needed solidity.

Defence is key for ten Hag and he will want Matthjis de Ligt to partner Lisandro Martinez in his first choice centre-half pairing with Harry Maguire and Victor Lindelof taking a back seat. Jonny Evans has signed on again for what could be his final season and he, Maguire and Lindelof are likely to be gradually eased out.
If they could find a buyer for either Maguire or Lindelof that would interest either player, they'd likely be gone already in truth.

Ten Hag has big hopes for Leny Yoro and feels the Frenchman has the talent to develop into an automatic starter. Luke Shaw, will now miss the first few weeks of the season after picking up yet another injury. But Dan Ashworth has confirmed Noussair Mazraoui is an option to play there.
At full strength he will do battle with Diogo Dalot for the starting right-back berth, but serious questions will now be asked over whether a new left back is needed.

Ten Hag likes to play two holding midfielders and Kobbie Mainoo is a shoe-in after his rapid progress over the last 12 months. Not only is he a regular for United, he has emerged as a starter for England and his energy and vision are real plusses.

The issue ten Hag has is who should play alongside him? At the minute it’s Casemiro or Scott McTominay and Ten Hag does not particularly want either. United have struggled to find takers for Casemiro because of his £350,000-a-week wages, while Fulham are keen on McTominay. Ten Hag must resolve this issue before the transfer window closes on August 30 and find a regular partner for Mainoo.
As it stands, Casemiro will get the nod, but he needs to improve dramatically after a really disappointing 2023-24 season.

Joshua Zirkzee will be expected to support Rasmus Hojlund and take some of the goalscoring burden from his shoulders. The Netherlands attacker is only young, but Ten Hag has great hopes for him as an alternative to the Dane.

He could nominally start on the right of United’s attack, allowing Bruno Fernandes to play as a No.10 and Alejandro Garnacho to start on the left. Fernandes had arguably his best campaign for United last season and will be crucial for his goals, creativity and experience.

Garnacho is hugely exciting on the left and he turned the Community Shield when he came on before City stole victory at the end. Hojlund again will expected to score the majority of goals and that’s a lot of pressure to dump on the shoulders of a 21-year-old.
Then there is the question of Marcus Rashford? If he's at his best, then expect to see him start down the left with Garnacho, who increasingly can't be ignored, moving over to the right.
That leaves the likes of Jadon Sancho, Antony and Amad all in reserve.

body: Erik ten Hag has been successful is in charm offensive for Matthijs de Ligt, who Manchester United have signed for £38.6million on a five-year contract from Bayern Munich
Manchester United have completed the signings of Bayern Munich pair Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui in a sensational double swoop on the eve of the new season.

De Ligt, 25, has put pen to paper on a five-year contract and could make his debut for United on Friday when the Red Devils begin their Premier League campaign at home to Fulham. United's outlay could rise to £42.9m as a result of £4.3m in potential add-ons.

Having learned his trade under Erik ten Hag at Ajax, De Ligt has been brought in to remedy the Red Devils' defensive injury woes. The Netherlands international will be joined at Old Trafford by former Bayern team-mate Noussair Mazraoui, who also starred in Ten Hag's Ajax team, once the Morocco right-back completes a separate £12.9m deal.

Despite only being a teenager, De Ligt captained Ten Hag's side that reached the semi-finals of the Champions League in 2019, famously beating both Real Madrid and Juventus before losing to Tottenham. The 25-year-old has been a long-term target for United, who failed to sign him two years ago when he moved from Italian giants Juventus, the club he'd left Ajax for.

De Ligt chose to join Bayern in 2022 and after a productive first season in which they won the Bundesliga title, injuries scuppered his second term under Thomas Tuchel. Ten Hag hopes that De Ligt, who didn't make an appearance for his country at Euro 2024, will rediscover his best form at Old Trafford, particularly in light of £52m signing Leny Yoro picking up a serious foot injury in pre-season.

The defender actually confirmed the transfer before the club, penning an emotional letter to Bayern fans. “Dear Bayern fans, I want to thank each and everyone of you for all your love and support. I have spent two amazing years playing for this beautiful club. It has been a true honour to have played for a club like Bayern Munich.
"We have achieved unforgettable moments together. Winning the title as well as several amazing CL- nights. These memories will stay with me forever.

“This is why leaving this club feels bittersweet. I will always remember the love and support I have received from the players, the staff members and from the fans. The recent petition signed by so many of you has touched me deeply.
“Thank you all for the two amazing years. I wish FC Bayern good luck winning many more titles, like Bayern has always done. Mia San Mia.”

“Erik ten Hag shaped the early stages of my career, so he knows how to get the best out of me and I cannot wait to work with him again. I know what it takes to succeed at the highest level, and I’m determined to continue that record at this special club.”

United's defence was decimated by injuries throughout last season and their lack of senior options for their defeat to Manchester City in the Community Shield on Saturday reinforced the need for additions. "It's clear we have the problems," Ten Hag admitted after losing to City on penalties.
"We have to work, the players have to work to be available and the staff have to work. Together it should be a good collaboration with the players who are available."

Mazraoui follows De Ligt in making the journey from Bavaria to Manchester and signs on the dotted line just hours after Aaron Wan-Bissaka's exit was confirmed. Wan-Bissaka signed for West Ham on Tuesday, admitting the decision to swap Old Trafford for the London Stadium was a 'no brainer'.

I know that I’m joining the club at an exciting time; everyone I’ve spoken to has the same ambition for us to win trophies together and I can feel the determination to achieve that.”

And Sporting Director Dan Ashworth has suggested Mazraoui could help out at left back in the early weeks of the new season. That follows the news that Luke Shaw will be sidelined until at least the first international break of the season.

Matthijs de Ligt has written an emotional goodbye message to Bayern Munich fans ahead of his move to Manchester United.

De Ligt flew over to Manchester from Munich on Monday to undergo a medical ahead of a reunion with his former Ajax boss Erik ten Hag. He and Noussair Mazraoui are joining in a double transfer worth £51.5million.

headline: Man Utd fans demand Erik ten Hag's next signing as club release official statement
body: Luke Shaw missed the end of last season through injury before making his return in the latter stages of Euro 2024 with England but has suffered another issue in Manchester United training
Manchester United fans have been left frustrated after defender Luke Shaw was ruled out for the start of the season.

The Red Devils revealed the defender suffered an injury in pre-season training, having not long returned from his summer break after participating in Euro 2024. Shaw did not play in the Premier League from February until the end of last season due a hamstring injury before returning to feature for England in the latter stages of the European competition.

Shaw joins the likes of Leny Yoro and Rasmus Hojlund on United's already problematic injury list. The 29-year-old is due to return in September following the international break should his rehabilitation go smoothly.
United's statement read: "Luke Shaw will miss the opening games of the Premier League season due to a calf injury sustained at the start of pre-season training.
"He is working hard on his rehabilitation with a view to being available after the first international break."
Supporters are calling for a new signing before the close of the transfer window, such is their exasperation. "Sell him now!! We’ve tried!! He’s not it," one fan said on X.
"As expected," added another. "I still maintain that Luke Shaw shouldn't be a Manchester United player beyond 2024. A left-back should have been our priority instead of a right-back."
"This is shameful .. it’s time we move on from him," echoed another supporter, while a further one noted:‌ "Time to move on from Shaw".

Shaw has previously expressed his frustrations over those who have questioned his commitment. The former Southampton ace revealed that he suffered his season-ending injury against Luton last term, in a situation where her probably should not have played.
“I felt something against Aston Villa and came off at half-time. I didn’t train the whole week and when the scan came back, there wasn’t too much there," explained the United defender.

“I then trained the day before the game (at Luton) - and if the manager asks me to play, I’m never going to say ‘no.’ But I shouldn’t have played. It’s kind of everyone’s fault. Partly my fault, partly the medical staff. I think everyone would admit that.”

headline: Man Utd on red alert as Paulo Dybala's wife 'makes feelings clear' on enormous offer
body: Roma forward Paulo Dybala could be an option for Manchester United this summer, but the Argentinian's wife will have a say in deciding her partner's transfer fate
Star forward Paulo Dybala would be a bargain coup for Manchester United this summer – and his wife could help with pulling off a transfer.

Roma are seemingly open to the idea of selling their World Cup-winner this summer, with only one year remaining on his contract in Italy's capital. That could be of interest to United boss Erik ten Hag, who is set to start the Premier League season without injured Rasmus Hojlund, while summer signing Joshua Zirkzee is still getting back to full fitness.

It may also interest the Red Devils to learn Saudi Arabia seemingly won't be in competition for the player's signature. That's after Gazzetta dello Sport reported Dybala's wife - the model and actress, Oriana Sabatini - isn't interested in uprooting their lives for a completely new culture in the Middle East.

Saudi outfit Al-Qadsiah reportedly made an offer to sign Dybala when the £10million release clause in his contract was still valid in July. The Giallorossi are back in full control of any sale now that deadline has passed, meaning United have already missed their chance at maximum value for a player who's reportedly been on their radar for years.

Dybala, 30, has enjoyed moderate success at Roma after scoring 34 goals across 77 appearances for the club. And manager Daniele De Rossi acknowledged sales are very plausible following a pre-season clash against Everton on English soil.

“Surely we have too many players, I had 31 at St. George’s Park," club legend De Rossi told Gazzetta dello Sport. "Some players will leave and play elsewhere, like in other Serie A clubs. You can’t work well with 31 players. If somebody goes, then we’ll focus on new signings.”

Roma's need to trim their ranks could also play in United's favour should Ten Hag deem it necessary to add more attacking reinforcements. Hojlund, 21, is set to be out until mid-September following injury on the club's summer tour of the US, while new man Zirkzee featured only sparingly in pre-season.

"Those who came to England are all Roma players, then we’ll see what happens," he continued. "This is true not only for Dybala but for everyone. When I was asked if there were players who should stay at all costs, I said no. Whoever wants to leave is free to do it.”

Those comments suggest former Juventus and Palermo forward Dybala will be granted an exit from the club should he want one and a club meets their payment expectations. And with Saudi seemingly out of the picture, genuine competition for the player's signature could be hard to come by.

headline: Aaron Wan-Bissaka made second transfer U-turn after Erik ten Hag influence
body: Aaron Wan-Bissaka has completed his move to West Ham, but only after the right-back was convinced to reject a departure from Manchester United by boss Erik ten Hag
Aaron Wan-Bissaka has made a second transfer U-turn to join West Ham, having previously been convinced to remain at Manchester United by Erik ten Hag.

Wan-Bissaka completed a £15million move to the Hammers on Tuesday, five years after he arrived at Old Trafford for £50m. It was ultimately a disappointing spell for the right-back though, who largely failed to live up to his huge price tag.

The Englishman came close to leaving the Red Devils last summer, having struggled up against Diogo Dalot. He was eventually convinced to remain at United, with the 26-year-old praising Ten Hag's influence for that decision.
After confirming he would be remaining at the club, Wan-Bissaka credited the Dutchman for his words of advice and management style, which swayed him into extending his stay at Old Trafford.

“It's been good, especially for myself. I've learned a lot under him. And there's more to come, more improvement to be done. So, yeah, I'm happy. He's helped the team. You can see the team's transition has changed,” Wan-Bissaka said last summer.

“I think before, it was just being left to play the game. But since I've been under him, the manager has taught me a lot. And you just want to improve more and keep learning more, especially from someone like him. So I've enjoyed that.

“It's things I've been working at. It's what the manager wants, he wants me in those areas of the pitch. It also helps the team, whether I've got the ball or not, just to make space for them and create opportunities.”

Wan-Bissaka has now reversed his stance though, with his final appearance for United came as they beat Manchester City in May's FA Cup final. He has become West Ham's eighth signing of the summer under new boss Julen Lopetegui.

And the right-back is hoping that the London Stadium can be the place where he reignites his career. He has admitted he is excited to get started, with the Hammers hosting Aston Villa in their opening game of the season.
“It was a no brainer for me to join West Ham – I’m excited and happy to be here,” the Englishman said. "It’s an amazing feeling to be back in London, and I’m excited for what’s coming.

"I was born here, so I know the ins and outs of London, which plays a big part in my life, so to be back playing in this city means a lot to me. I’m happy to be here, am grateful for the warm welcome, and I am excited to be playing for the Club and will give it my all.

“I can’t wait to get on the pitch, get to know the players, and push on from there. I see a team that is in it together, that will push each other to win, and a group that has got each others' backs through thick and thin, so being part of that and having that insurance helps a lot when you are surrounded by a good squad.”

headline: Adidas unveils new trefoil third kits for Man Utd and Arsenal ahead of Premier League season
body: The iconic trefoil jersey has been revived for the third shirts of five major European clubs ahead of the 2024/25 season

Adidas has unveiled the return of its iconic trefoil kits for five major European clubs ahead of the 2024/25 season. The German sportswear brand has designed five all-new third jerseys for Manchester United, Arsenal, Real Madrid, Bayern Munich and Juventus to commemorate its upcoming 75th anniversary.

Each shirt features the brand’s classic trefoil logo, which replaces the three stripes Performance logo. The shirts for Man Utd, Bayern Munich and Juventus also have unique club crests that replace the traditional versions seen on the club’s current home and away kits.

The new kits were launched in a multi-club release featuring legends from each club, with Rio Ferdinand, Patrick Vieira, Bastian Schweinsteiger, Alessandro Del Piero and Zinedine Zidane coming together to model the shirts. Announcing the new release, Adidas said: “Over the past few decades, the adidas trefoil has come to represent the latest in contemporary street style and, since 2000, has been used exclusively for adidas Originals collections and limited-edition jerseys designed for off-pitch wear.

“With the 75th anniversary of the brand approaching in 2025, adidas is bringing it back to the pitch, not only with a nod to its status in the history of the sport, but also in recognition of the increasing role fashion plays in the contemporary game.”

The new Man Utd 24/25 Third shirt has a red, white and black tricolor flag emblazoned across the chest and on the back of the neck beneath a seasonal crew-neck collar featuring the words ‘Manchester United’. The traditional club crest has been replaced by the iconic club devil, while the trefoil logo makes a return to a United shirt for the first time since the 1990s.

The Arsenal 24/25 Third shirt is touted as a modern take on the beloved 90s iconic kits that features a ‘bold [and] fashionable’ lilac and aqua design, combined with a ‘hint of nostalgia’. It has a crew neck collar, matching sleeve detailing and cannon crest, which Adidas says ‘combine to create a vibrant, eye-catching look’.

Fans of each club can pick up their new trefoil Third shirt from Fanatics. Both the Man Utd Third shirt and Arsenal Third shirt are available for £80, with the Man Utd Authentic and Arsenal Authentic shirts coming in at £110.

Long-sleeved editions are also available for Man Utd and Arsenal for £85. Female fans can buy their Man Utd Womens Third shirt and Arsenal Womens Third shirt, or the Man Utd Womens Authentic and Arsenal Womens Authentic shirts for the same prices.

Football fans can also bag the new Real Madrid, Bayern Munich and Juventus Third shirts from Fanatics. Elsewhere, Kitbag is offering football fans free shirt printing on select shirts in a deal that saves £15.

Shoppers can select their team’s shirts, choose their size and add customisation with their favourite player’s name and number at no extra cost. The deal is available on both Man Utd and Arsenal’s new 2024/25 Home shirts, which are priced at £75 and £80 respectively.

headline: Match of the Day: Two replacements taking over from Ian Wright named by the BBC
body: Ian Wright announced at the end of last season that he would be leaving Match of the Day after more than 25 years on the iconic BBC One show, with two former England stars set to step into the breach
Former England internationals Theo Walcott and Joe Hart are set to fill the large shoes left by Ian Wright on Match of the Day.

The 60-year-old Arsenal legend announced his departure in December last year, more than 27 years after he made his debut on the iconic show, having become a regular fixture alongside presenter Gary Lineker and the Premier League's all-time record goalscorer, Alan Shearer.

But with the new Premier League season getting underway this week, the BBC have now revealed the two former Three Lions stars that will be trying to follow in his footsteps on the weekly highlights show, in an event with former host Des Lynam, joining the likes of Shearer, Shay Given and Micah Richards on the BBC's flagship show.

Both stars have stepped into the world of punditry recently following their retirement from football. Walcott has appeared on Sky Sports' covering the Premier League and impressed while Hart played his part in the BBC's coverage of Euro 2024 this summer after ending his playing career as a title winner with Scottish champions Celtic.
After announcing his exit earlier this year, Wright admitted he was looking forward to getting his weekends back.

He explained: "I’m stepping back having made great friends and many great memories. This decision has been coming for a while, maybe my birthday earlier this year fast tracked it a little, but ultimately it’s time to do a few more different things with my Saturdays.
"I’m really looking forward to my last months on the show and covering what will hopefully be an amazing Premier League title race."

He added: “I don't want to stay over in Manchester. I used to but there are personal reasons why I always want to get back home (after filming). Especially, when you're on Match of the Day, you're live and I've had a massive problem before with people knowing where you are, so I always want to get back home to the missus and the girls.
“I'm getting older, I just want to make sure I use the time well and efficiently for myself and at the moment, Match of the Day is the one that if something had to go, it had to be that.”

headline: Mikel Arteta feud reignited as Premier League confirm referees for opening fixtures
body: The Premier League have announced their refereeing appointments for the first game of the season and Mikel Arteta is unlikely to be happy when he finds out who is in charge of Arsenal's clash with Wolves
The Premier League has confirmed their refereeing appointments for the first round of the new season, with Mikel Arteta set to be reunited with an old foe.

Arteta has had frequent run-ins with officials ever since he took charge of Arsenal back in December 2019. That will likely be no different in the upcoming campaign, with the Gunners expected to once again challenge for the title.
They start their season with a visit from Wolves on Saturday, with the Midlands side having not beaten them since February 2021. But Arteta will have to contend with Jarred Gillett acting as referee.

The duo infamously clashed last season during a defeat to Aston Villa, which Gillett was in the middle for. Arteta claimed the Australian had made two major errors, ruling Kai Havertz's late equaliser out for handball after previously turning down an earlier shout for a penalty from the Gunners.

When asked about the decisions by Sky Sports, he initially refused to comment, but when pressed if he had an opinion on the decision stated simply: “I do, a big opinion.” He later told Match of the Day: “It’s clear and obvious for me”.

The Spaniard was immediately asked about both decisions when he entered his post-match press conference, to which he merely responded: “Clear and obvious”. Asked to clarify he reiterated: "That's what I mean, clear and obvious. That's my opinion, that's all I can say."

Elsewhere, Manchester United and Fulham kick off the new season on Friday night, with Rob Jones the referee. Newly promoted Ipswich Town host Liverpool in the weekend's second game on Saturday lunchtime, with Tim Robinson on duty.

Simon Hooper will take charge of Brighton's trip to Everton, while Craig Pawson will be in tthe middle for Newcastle's clash against Southampton. The final 3pm kick-off will be handled by Michael Oliver at Nottingham Forest's game against Bournemouth.
Meanwhile, Tony Harrington will oversee Villa's visit to West Ham in the 5.30pm slot. The first 'Super Sunday' of the season will see Sam Barrott referee Brentford's clash with Crystal Palace.

Anthony Taylor has been handed the responsibility for the weekend's bumper tie, as he will oversee Manchester City's trip to Chelsea. Last season, City boss Pep Guardiola sarcastically hit out at the official following his side's 3-3 draw with Tottenham.

Guardiola was left furious with a decision and when asked if Taylor had given him an explanation, the Spaniard told beIN Sports: "No, the master of commander Anthony Taylor knows everything in this business and didn't tell me anything."
The final game of round one will come from the King Power Stadium, where Leicester return to the Premier League with a visit from Tottenham. Chris Kavanagh has been handed the whistle for that one.

headline: Ruud van Nistelrooy making immediate impact at Man Utd after Benni McCarthy decision
body: Manchester United legend Ruud van Nistelrooy has wasted no time in making his mark back at Old Trafford after arriving as part of manager Erik ten Hag's new-look staff
Almost two decades after he first left Manchester United, Ruud van Nistelrooy is once again grabbing headlines at Old Trafford.

However, it's not the Dutchman's finishing that's firing up the Red Devils these days; rather, it's the wisdom he's imparting upon the current stable of striker talent at Erik ten Hag's disposal. That's after United cut ties with another former Premier League hitman, Benni McCarthy, to bring a club legend back into their ranks as Ten Hag's assistant.

Van Nistelrooy, 48, already appears to have built a rapport with certain players and was seen encouraging Marcus Rashford after the forward missed a big chance in the Community Shield defeat by Manchester City on penalties. Reserve goalkeeper Tom Heaton also recently praised the comeback king and referred to his coaching as "outstanding" not long after his arrival.

The Daily Mail reported in July that Van Nistelrooy - who scored 150 goals in five years at United - took a leading role in training on their pre-season tour of the United States. Like Ten Hag, the Red Devils icon left an Eredivisie manager role (at PSV) to complete his return to United, so it makes sense he'd expect to maintain a prominent voice in his new surroundings.

Despite the club coup, it came at the cost of a well-liked staff figure in McCarthy, who was one of Ten Hag's first coaching appointments in the summer of 2022. The ex-Blackburn and West Ham striker served as a first-team coach at United, while Van Nistelrooy is one of Ten Hag's two assistants, but many of their priorities helping the attack may overlap.

That being said, Heaton has also highlighted his former team-mate's influence on the defensive side of things, "because he understands that side of it too." And that should aid the Dutch-born defensive duo of Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui once their moves are made official.

Rashford was highly complimentary of McCarthy's impact at Old Trafford and told SuperSport in March 2023: "I think he has done a good job. It's always good for us to have a particular coach that concentrates on us as a forwards group. We have worked more as a team going forward which has led us to creating more chances and scoring more goals."

Given his predatory scent for the goal during his playing days, it aligns that Van Nistelrooy should be in little mood to waste time back at his former stomping ground. The veteran won a Premier League title, FA Cup and League Cup during his time at Old Trafford but left following a fallout with Sir Alex Ferguson's then-assistant, Carlos Queiroz.

Now in the No. 2 role himself, Van Nistelrooy will seek to succeed where Queiroz perhaps did not as he looks to shepherd Rashford & Co to new heights. He has his work cut out for him considering United's decline since old boss Ferguson departed, but there are few alumni better qualified to reignite the revival - and it's already showing.

headline: Double Man Utd deal could take Gary Neville's relationship fears to another level
body: Gary Neville has previously spoken about the importance of having a consistent back four at Manchester United - which is going to be shaken up once again this season
Gary Neville has long expressed concerns about Manchester United's lack of defensive unity - a worry that could be heightened by their imminent double signing.

Bayern Munich pair Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui completed their medicals on Monday (August 12) before their expected moves to Old Trafford. If they sign on the dotted line in time, both could make their debut in United's Premier League opener against Fulham on Friday (August 16).

They've each previously played under Erik ten Hag at Ajax and are likely to become key components in the Dutchman's defensive strategy. Ten Hag has struggled to field a consistent backline due to a mix of form and injury problems, with Lisandro Martinez, Harry Maguire, Raphael Varane, and Victor Lindelof all sidelined at different times last season.

The addition of De Ligt and Mazraoui could offer more stability in the long run, even if it means more adjustments in the short term. This will necessitate the formation of new partnerships along the backline - a point Neville has previously emphasised, particularly in relation to Diogo Dalot, who may now find his position in the team under threat.

He heaped praise on the Portugal international's assist to Scott McTominay for United's winning goal against Aston Villa last season. During his podcast, the former England right-back highlighted the 25-year-old's potential, emphasising his physical attributes and footballing skills.

He remarked on the Gary Neville Podcast: "Dalot is someone that people say about the 'right back for the future' for Manchester United - they may have the right back for the future there. There is a lot there; he's six foot, he's strong, he's powerful, he's good on the ball, he's not a bad defender, I think he defends his back post really well, he opens up his shoulders.

"I think if he can start playing in a really confident back four and a settled back four... it's always changing and he's never really got a constant presence outside of him on that right hand side I had that for years, where I could build a relationship!

"Dalot, I think, is someone that you talk about 'could he' be the one that you think, you'll give him that shot. He's getting that shot at the moment but I wouldn't be too quickly looking to change him, I think he's something to work with."

Reports claim United have agreed a deal with Bayern worth €50m (£42.9m) for Dutch defender De Ligt, €45m (£38.6m) of that paid over three years with €5m (£4.3m) in add-ons. Morocco international Mazraoui, meanwhile, is moving in a £17.2m deal which is an initial £12.9m plus performance-related bonuses worth £4.3m.

headline: Erik ten Hag is about to do something at Man United he's done twice before - but he doesn't want to
body: If Manchester United's supporters are anticipating a flying start against Fulham on Friday night, recent history shows they should not get too carried away.

United have been slow starters in each of their first two Premier League campaigns under Erik ten Hag, losing their opening two games in 2022/23 and limping their way to a fortunate 1-0 victory over Wolves in their opening game last season.

The Reds were second best for long spells against the Black Country outfit in last season's curtain-raiser, conceding 23 shots. Had Wolves remembered to pack their shooting boots, United would have started the season with another home defeat.

United, just as they did in 2022 and 2023, head into their season opener as favourites to get off to a winning start. Although results have been indifferent in recent weeks, performances during pre-season, plus at Wembley on Saturday, have been encouraging.

However, scoring goals has not come naturally for Ten Hag's men, highlighted by their tally of seven from their six warm-up matches. United worked some terrific openings against Manchester City in the Community Shield but only found the back of the net once, highlighting just how big a hole Rasmus Hojlund leaves up front.
The Dane is going to miss the start of the season after suffering a hamstring injury in pre-season. He faces up to six weeks out, meaning the earliest he could return is September.

United bolstered their attack last month, swooping for Joshua Zirkzee from Bologna. However, he has since admitted that he is not a direct replacement for Hojlund, insisting he is not a natural No.9 and that he prefers to play as a secondary striker, linking the midfield with the attack.

He failed to make it off the bench against City, meaning he is still awaiting his debut, and it is unlikely that Ten Hag will throw him straight in from the off against the Cottagers. Bruno Fernandes started as a 'false nine' against City and it is likely he will operate in the same role against Fulham.

If that proves to be the case, United will start their Premier League opener for the third season running without an out-and-out centre-forward on the pitch; Christian Eriksen operated as a 'false nine' in a failed experiment against Brighton & Hove Albion two years ago and Marcus Rashford led the attack 12 months ago.

headline: Manchester United star fighting for his future once again after transfer decision
body: Harry Maguire became a pantomime villain after an awful 2021/22 season but nobody is laughing at the Manchester United defender anymore after a show of strength last term.

Maguire was booed by Australian fans of United on tour during Erik ten Hag's first pre-season but he's put a few challenging years behind him and has moved forward. The last 12 months have seen a resurgent Maguire regain the trust of Ten Hag and a place in the team.

He was the most dependable centre-back last season, he delivered excellent performances and the gloss was only taken by a few injuries. Maguire played through the pain barrier for United in the spring but finally succumbed to injury, which meant he was unavailable for the FA Cup final and the European Championship.

"I worked so hard throughout the year," Maguire told the MEN on pre-season tour this summer. "To get myself in a position where I was in a really good position physically and in a really good position mentally to to play in the FA Cup final and then thinking about the Euros after that.

"To have an injury which was, to be honest, not a big injury – it was just a calf injury, but it was only a three-week injury, but I just had three setbacks with it. When I first did the injury (in early May), I thought I'd be fit for the FA Cup final. So I pushed myself for the final.

"And then I had a setback in the week leading up to the final, which ruled me out of it. At that time again, it was no problem, I was going to be fit for the Euros. Then I went away with England and I had another setback, so yeah, it was so frustrating.

"When I look back, I wish I had no chance with all of them, so I could have got my head around it. But I thought I was going to play in the cup final or be involved at some stage and I thought 100 per cent I'd be involved at the Euros. But it just didn't happen and maybe I just pushed myself to get back too early, but definitely it was the toughest moment of my career, definitely."

Although Maguire was stripped of the captain's armband last year, he is still a leader at Carrington and personally greeted every academy player on the first day of pre-season. Now aged 31, Maguire has the experience to help younger players and enjoys doing so, something that he reflected upon when he was asked about new signing Leny Yoro.

"I must say I haven't trained too much with him," Maguires said last month. "But I've seen clips and I've seen attributes in a centre back of an 18-year-old that you'd want, every single attribute he's got.
"We must remind ourselves he is really young. There are going to be mistakes but he has every attribute of a centre-back in the modern game, he has it. So I’m sure he’s going to have a bright future.

"It’s our job as senior centre backs, my job, to help him along, communicate well, let him know what to expect. There are going to be times where I’m sure he’ll feel the world is on top of him, there are also going to be times where he’s going to feel like the best player in the world. And that’s what this club brings.

"I think it’s really important us senior lads help the young boys at the club. You’re starting to see now there’s so much talent in this squad but they’re going to need to be guided in the right direction and I think that’s definitely a role of mine and other lads as well."

The young players are the future of United but Maguire is the present. Not many expected that to still be the case in 2024, but he has fought his back to be regarded as a key player for the club again and is expected to start the new season's opening game against Fulham.

The addition of Matthijs de Ligt adds competition to Maguire, Yoro, Lisandro Martinez and Jonny Evans for minutes. Just like he did in the Community Shield, Martinez is likely to start at left-back against Fulham on Friday, which means Ten Hag could potentially pick Maguire to partner De Ligt in central defence.

When Martinez relocates to centre-back, there will be a choice between De Ligt and Maguire to make and you'd be foolish to bet against the latter. He has remarkable resilience and an added incentive to perform because there is just one year left on his contract, although United do have the option of another year.
It didn't make sense to sell Maguire this summer and he must fight not to be offloaded next year.
